page.title: 06GREAT NORTH ROAD STEVENAGE
page.content: The{Great North Road,}which played a dominant role in shaping the history of Stevenage, has now been almost obliterated. Small stretches may be seen beside the Leisure Centre and Six Hills Way.By 1800 about 20 coaches passed every day some of these were mail coaches and they were targets for robbers. On March Ist 1810,mail bags containing letters intended for Hatfield,Welwyn,Stevenage and other towns along the Great North Road were stolen.A new mail sorting office has just been built alongside the old road and close to the new railway station . As soon as the railway came Stevenage coaching days were over.In 1868 the Stevenage Biggleswade Turnpike Trust was ended and the parts ot the road in Hertfordshire were taken over by the Hitchin District Highways Board.
